summary: This is an internal email or incident report from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, detailing the discovery of inmate Jeffrey Epstein unresponsive in his cell on the morning of August 10, 2019, and his subsequent death at a local hospital. The report notes bruising and the presence of a makeshift noose.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, and later pronounced dead at a hospital.

persons.name: Associate Warden MCC New York
persons.context: The sender or author of the report, located at 150 Park Row, New York, NY.

events.title: Discovery of Jeffrey Epstein Unresponsive
events.description: At approximately 6:33 a.m., staff found inmate Jeffrey Epstein unresponsive in his cell while attempting to serve breakfast. Life-saving measures were initiated.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Pronounced Dead
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was pronounced dead at a local hospital at 7:36 a.m. after being transported from the correctional center.

locations: 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, on the morning of August 10, 2019.
Institution medical staff reported he had 'circumfricial bruising around the neck' and an 'orange makeshift noose' was found in his cell.
He was pronounced dead at a local hospital at 7:36 a.m. on August 10, 2019.
